alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 04 at 11:53PM CDT until September 05 at 2:15AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT MONDAY FOR EAST CENTRAL CHEROKEE COUNTY... At 1153 PM CDT, Emergency Management reported flash flooding in Gaylesville with significant flooding along the Chattooga River. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency Management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Bluff, Gaylesville, Cornwall Furnace Park, Eastern Weiss Lake and Fullerton. Flood waters have reached Hwy 68. Several roads in this area remain impassable. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
